thread.title: Injuries threaten Manchester City from running away with EPL race - Planet Futbol -
thread.title_full: Injuries threaten Manchester City from running away with EPL race - Planet Futbol - SI.com

title: Injuries threaten Manchester City from running away with EPL race - Planet Futbol -
text:
by Jonathan Wilson Twitter Email Posted: Thu Oct. 15, 2015 Chelsea is in crisis with Jose Mourinho under pressure and flailing at a raft of enemies, real and imagined. Manchester United is still inconsistent under Louis van Gaal. Liverpool and Tottenham are struggling to get going. Arsenal remains eternally Arsenal. The start of this season should have been an opportunity for Manchester City to reassert itself and take a commanding Premier League lead and, it’s true, it does top the table by two points. It remains favorite to reclaim the league title. Yet significant doubts remain.
Manchester City plays an injury-ravaged Bournemouth at home on Saturday, which should represent a relatively straightforward three points. With Manchester United away at Everton and Arsenal away at Watford, the Citizens may even increase their lead, or at least see one of their closest challengers lose ground. But there’s a sense in which the Bournemouth game isn’t really about the here and now but about the future and, specifically, whether City can cope without key members of its spine. After all, the following weekend, City travel five miles west to take on United in the Manchester derby, a game that could have huge ramifications for the title race.
Everything seemed to have gotten back on track with the 6-1 win over Newcastle United two weeks ago.
